question_text: Explain two effects of soil erosion on agriculture.
model_answer: Soil erosion removes topsoil, reducing soil fertility and crop yields. It can also lead to siltation of waterways and loss of arable land, which makes farming harder and can reduce available farmland.

rubric.5: Explains two effects clearly with detail
rubric.3: Mentions two effects with limited detail
rubric.1: Mentions one effect or vague answer

student_answer: Erosion removes the topsoil so crops do not grow well. It also washes soil into rivers which can block them.
